definitions: To break a small piece off something.
To hit a ball or puck high into the air over a short distance.
To insert a microchip into an animal for identification.
To contribute a small amount of money or effort to a joint activity.
examples: She chipped the edge of the teacup.
He chipped the ball over the goalkeeper.
All pets must be chipped by law.
Everyone chipped in for the present.
